page.title: 11FLOWER FESTIVAL
page.content: On June 29th, the week of Parwich Wakes, there was a flower festival at the church. Mrs. Simpson asked our class to make some flower baskets for the window-sills in the church. The day before, we all brought flowers, leaves and moss to school. We had chicken wire in plastic bowls. We fixed moss around the bowls to make them look pretty and made a handle with ivy. Then we arranged the flowers and leaves in the baskets. When we were finished, we walked down to the church carrying them. Everyone was busy inside. There were huge piles of flowers waiting to be arranged. We walked round and had a look at the arrangements. A lot of people in the village helped to decorate the church and even more came to look at the flower festival.
